intro: Billardiera explanata, commonly known as the broad-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant forms dense clusters on the branches of its host trees, often leading to the death of the host due to its parasitic nature. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, which can remain viable for many years. Billardiera explanata plays a significant role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
